duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate with the engineering team to develop and refine customer products. Generate detailed designs, perform feasibility studies, and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Develop Design Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (DFMEA) documents. Evaluate designs for potential failure modes and recommend design improvements to improve product reliability and safety.
Contribute to the creation of DVP&R documents outlining testing and validation procedures. Work with test team to ensure successful execution and documentation of verification tests.
Participate in CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) reviews, mentor, evaluate simulations, and contribute to refining designs based on CAE analysis.

Work closely with the purchasing department to review the sourcing of components and materials required for the products. Ensure timely availability of resources while adhering to cost and quality considerations.
Support technical reviews with suppliers to ensure alignment on design specifications, manufacturing processes, and quality standards. Address any technical concerns and collaborate on resolution.
Manage and facilitate the processes, ensuring that design changes are accurately evaluated, detailed, and implemented while minimizing disruptions.
Participate in tooling kick-off meetings to ensure accurate and timely development of required manufacturing tools and equipment.
Collaborate with multiple teams to ensure readiness for production, addressing any last-minute design or engineering adjustments.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Advanced degree is a plus.
